attributes.action: Dear Prime Minister, I would like to draw your attention to one misleading Rule in Our Highway code, which is rule number 175 on page 60 of  our Highway code which gives the power to driver when the light goes to Amber he/she should stop or carry on to avoid crash, but when someone take action with a clear intention not cause accident and carry on but traffic camera take their picture then police don,t listen at all and the driver get penalties. Some inocent people get fined as well and loose their licence too. Traffic camera's are not altered according to weather conditons that's what is wrong. I need to explain this in greater details if you are prepared to hear me on this serious matter which is conected with all british citizen's. Thanks nd hope to hear from you soon.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to

rejection.details: Please rephrase your title; it needs to be shorter and should be a clear call for action, preferably starting with a verb, and not a name or statement.
reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
